description: Build a developer-focused SaaS platform with robust API, usage-based billing, comprehensive documentation, and enterprise-grade reliability - following Stripe's proven architecture.

frontend.rationale: Stripe uses React-based framework for SEO-friendly marketing pages and complex dashboard UIs. Next.js provides excellent developer experience.

backend.rationale: JavaScript consistency across stack. tRPC for type-safe APIs. Stripe-level API design principles.

database.rationale: PostgreSQL for transactional data and complex queries. Redis for caching, rate limiting, and session management.

billing.rationale: Use Stripe's own billing infrastructure for payments, add custom metering for usage-based pricing.

monitoring.rationale: Comprehensive monitoring and error tracking essential for developer-facing products with SLA requirements.

infrastructure.rationale: Multi-region deployment for global availability. Infrastructure as code for consistency and compliance.

auth.rationale: Developer-focused authentication with API keys for machine-to-machine communication and JWT for user sessions.

questions.text: What pricing model best fits your SaaS platform?

choices.label: Usage-based (pay per API call/transaction)
choices.impact: Requires metering infrastructure, complex billing calculations

choices.label: Subscription tiers (monthly/annual plans)
choices.impact: Simpler billing, feature gating, user tier management

choices.label: Hybrid (base subscription + usage overages)
choices.impact: Most complex billing, combines both approaches

choices.label: Freemium (free tier + paid features)
choices.impact: User conversion tracking, usage limit enforcement

questions.impact: Determines billing architecture complexity and metering requirements

questions.text: How complex will your API offerings be?

choices.label: Full platform (APIs + webhooks + marketplace)
choices.impact: Complex architecture, partner ecosystem, app marketplace

questions.impact: Affects API design complexity, documentation needs, and SDK requirements

questions.text: What compliance standards do you need to meet?
questions.impact: Determines security architecture, audit requirements, and data handling procedures

questions.text: Do you need global deployment with regional data residency?
questions.impact: Requires multi-region architecture, data localization, and compliance considerations

questions.text: Will you need a comprehensive webhook system for customer integrations?
questions.impact: Requires event system, retry logic, webhook signature verification, and delivery guarantees

metrics.apiUsage: API calls per day, unique integrations
metrics.revenue: Monthly recurring revenue, average revenue per user
metrics.quality: API uptime, response times, error rates

risks.mitigation: Load testing, caching strategies, auto-scaling infrastructure
Thorough testing of billing logic, audit trails, reconciliation processes
Retry mechanisms, dead letter queues, delivery status tracking
Comprehensive rate limiting, API key management, security headers
Privacy by design, regular compliance audits, legal review

successFactors: Exceptional API documentation and developer experience

competitorAnalysis.Stripe: Payments focus, excellent DX, complex pricing at scale
competitorAnalysis.Twilio: Communications APIs, broad portfolio, enterprise focus
competitorAnalysis.SendGrid: Email focus, acquired by Twilio, strong deliverability
